title: Online Workshop on Enhancing Mathematical Creativity Based on Thai Higher Education Teacher Professional Standards: A Connectivist Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics education experience (algebra, geometry, statistics, etc.), basic online platform usage skills, and understanding of mathematical problem-solving strategies (formula application, graph interpretation, probability calculation, etc.)
context.additional_context: A mixed asynchronous/synchronous activity structure optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, a practice-centered mathematics creativity development program for in-service teachers. Emphasizes digital tool utilization to strengthen computational skills (equation solving, statistical analysis) and logical reasoning (proof, spatial reasoning).

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more strategies to restructure mathematics educational content (equations, graphs, statistics, etc.) based on the C5 model and enhance computational and proof strategies.
Learners can design learner-engaged digital environments (Zoom polling, Padlet, etc.) according to connectionist principles to visualize and analyze mathematical problem-solving processes.

Learners can develop two types of math creativity-enhancing class activities (e.g., probability games, spatial reasoning tasks) applying the AAA model (Analyze-Assemble-Application) and integrate formula application and data interpretation skills.
Learners can perform peer feedback using evaluation rubrics based on Thai teacher professional standards and apply assessment criteria for mathematical thinking (calculation, reasoning, analysis).

resources: Zoom Basic Features (Screen Sharing, Real-Time Chat)
Translated Thai Teacher Professional Standards Document
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
